articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz ordered the army on Thursday to prepare a plan to allow the "voluntary departure" of residents from the Gaza strip, Israeli media reported.
articles.title: Israel's defense minister orders army to prepare for Gaza residents' departure, media reports

articles.author: Jaimi Dowdell, Lena Masri, Giulia Paravicini, Ryan Mcneill, Nafisa Eltahir
articles.description: The Trump administration’s effort to slash and reshape American foreign aid is crippling the intricate global system that aims to prevent and respond to famine.
articles.title: Halt in U.S. aid cripples global efforts to relieve hunger

articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: Jordan's King Abdullah plans to tell Trump that his proposal will spread chaos through the Middle East and jeopardize the Kingdom's peace with Israel.
articles.title: A recipe for radicalism: Jordan raises red flags over Trump's relocation plan

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: A key safety system was turned off on a U.S. Army helicopter that collided with an American Airlines regional jet last week near Washington Reagan Airport, killing 67.
articles.title: Key safety system off in Army helicopter that collided with American Airlines jet, senator says

articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump will sign an executive order on Thursday to sanction the International Criminal Court for targeting the United States and its allies, such as Israel, according to a White House official.
articles.title: What is the International Criminal Court?

articles.author: Elida Moreno
articles.description: Panama President Jose Raul Mulino said on Thursday the U.S. was spreading "lies and falsehoods" after the State Department claimed U.S. government vessels would be able to pass through the Panama Canal without paying.
articles.title: Panama president to US: stop 'lies and falsehoods' about canal

articles.author: Erin Banco, Jonathan Landay, Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: President Donald Trump's administration plans to keep fewer than 300 staff at the U.S. Agency for International Development out of the agency's worldwide total of more than 10,000, four sources told Reuters on Thursday.
articles.title: Trump administration to keep only 294 USAID staff out of over 10,000 globally, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A contingent of 144 additional Kenyan police arrived in the Haitian capital of Port-au-Prince on Thursday, part of a multinational security force backed by the United Nations.
articles.title: New contingent of Kenyan police arrive in Haitian capital

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israel army said in a statement early on Friday that it conducted a strike in Lebanese territory on two military sites that contained Hezbollah weapons.
articles.title: Israel army conducts strike in Lebanese territory on two military sites

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: The U.S. Justice Department under President Donald Trump is disbanding an effort started after Russia's 2022 invasion of Ukraine to enforce sanctions and target oligarchs close to the Kremlin.
articles.title: Trump administration disbands task force targeting Russian oligarchs
